intro: Tetragonia trigyna, commonly known as the New Zealand spinach, is a flowering plant in the family Aizoaceae. It is native to New Zealand and has adapted to grow in coastal and sandy soils. The plant features succulent leaves that are edible and often used in salads or cooked dishes. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in clusters, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Tetragonia trigyna is valued for its nutritional content and ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
